comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
CWGC website shows him as Private Norman Alderdice G/6613 and he is commemorated at the Arras Memorial. No family details are given.

His MIC shows his rank as Sjt [sic].

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
There is an online family tree which had the same date of death for Norman Harvey Alderdice born 23 Nov 1877 in Belfast. Shown to be the son of William Alderdice and Rachel Kathleen Monroe (1844-1933). 

He married Dorothy Rendell (1895-1955) and had 2 daughters: Norma Monroe Alderdice (1913-1999) and Pamela MacKay Alderdice (1915). All 3 were born in St John's, Newfoundland, Canada.

comment.author: 79037172@N04
comment._content: The spelling of Serjeant with a "J" was common then and is still the case in Guards regiments at least.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Lieutenant British Infantry 6th Battalion, The Queen's (Royal West Surrey Regiment) Lieutenant Newfoundland Infantry Royal Newfoundland Regiment Granted Commission, Lieutenant, Sept. 24, 1914: Relinquished Commission, Oct. 8, 1915, and joined a unit of the Imperial Army. www.canadiangreatwarproject.com/searches/soldierDetail.as...
